intro: Oligosporus ledebourianus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oligosporus ledebourianus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
